title: Blog Workflow

content:
basic initialize local repository
git init make untracked file tracked
git add [file] git add . # add all commit changes
git commit -m "message" view current information about git
git status remote repository set a new remote repo
git remote add origin [https or ssh] # origin is the default name of remote repo view current remote repo
git remote -v change url
git remote set-url [https or ssh] æ‹‰å–è¿œç¨‹ä»“åº“
git pull git pull origin master >>> Already up to date. upload
git push -u origin master # first time git push origin master git push
summary: basic initialize local repository git init make untracked file tracked git add [file] git add . # add all commit changes git commit -m "message" view current information about git git status remote repository set a new remote repo git remote add origin [https or ssh] # origin is the default name of remote repo view current remote repo git remote -v change url git remote set-url [https or ssh] æ‹‰å–è¿œç¨‹ä»“åº“ git pull git pull origin master >>> Already up to date. upload git push -u origin master # first time git push origin master git push
